learning_outcomes.description: Analyse physical and psychosocial theories related to ageing and examine issues related to ageism.
Examine common health conditions and issues related to older adulthood and identify strategies to implement person-centred care across a range of healthcare settings.
Explore and critique nursing roles and inter-professional roles and relationships within health and community care settings used by older adults.

Demonstrate cultural responsiveness when working with older adults and older adults from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities and culturally and linguistically diverse (CALD) backgrounds.
Demonstrate inclusiveness and supportive care when working with older adults from lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and intersex communities.

assessments.due_date:
16/03/2026 10:00 am

This online invigilated MCQ quiz will be completed in-class. Please note that you will only be able to access and complete this assessment at this time. Please check your timetable to confirm the day, time and venue. You will need to arrive at the entry to the timetabled room 10 minutes before the scheduled start time.
assessments.task_description:
The MCQ quiz will be accessible through the course Blackboard site. Questions for this assessment will come from the information covered in the Introduction Module and Modules 1, 2 & 3. You will have 60 minutes to answer 40 multiple choice questions. Each question is worth 0.5 marks, totalling 20 marks. Students will only have ONE ATTEMPT to complete this quiz.

For full details of this assessment please refer to the course NURS7125 BlackBoard site, Assessment folder.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The quiz is accessed via Blackboard, and will self-submit after 60 minutes. This is an identity verified assessment, and instructors will check your student ID as you enter the room. Students who arrive late or who do not have their student ID card with them will not be permitted to enter the room and will fail this assessment with zero (0) marks. Students who are not in class and identity verified when they sit this online MCQ quiz will fail this assessment with zero (0) marks.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.assessment_title: Essay: Person Centred Care Within the Context of Dementia
assessments.task_description:
For full details of this assessment please refer to the course NURS7125 BlackBoard site, Assessment folder.

This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT). Students are advised that the use of AI or MT technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: This assessment requires students to submit an electronic version of their assignment via Blackboard. The electronic version of your assignment will be submitted via Blackboard, using the Turnitin software.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom O-week To Week 13(16 Feb - 31 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Online Learning - Blackboard (Independent Study)

There are seven modules in Blackboard for students to work on throughout the semester. The expectation is that students will spend seven hours per week on this content including time preparing for IBL tutorials.

learning_activities.topic:
Inquiry Based Learning (IBL) Tutorials

Inquiry Based Learning (IBL) tutorials. Six IBLs are scheduled across the semester. Further details of each IBL can be found in the Learning Resources tab and the IBL Preparation tab in the NURS7125 Blackboard site.

learning_activities.topic:
Older Adults' Health Lecture Series

There are six face to face Lectures on campus during the semester. Further details of each session can be found in the learning resources tab on the companion NURS7125 Blackboard website for this course. Lecture dates and times can be found on your timetable. Lectures are recorded for revision purposes.
